reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Supporting Uganda’s Response to HIV/AIDS and Tuberculosis Reduction Strategy

description.narrative: Uganda - TB/HIV - The AIDS Support Organisation (Uganda) Limited - TASO. This program has the following goals: To reduce the number of new youth and adult infections by 70% and the number of new paediatric HIV infections by 95% by 2020. To decrease HIV-associated morbidity and mortality by 70% through achieving and maintaining 90% viral suppression by 2020. To reduce vulnerability to HIV/AIDS and mitigation of its impact on PLHIV and other vulnerable groups. The goal is to reduce the incidence by 5% by 2019/20: from 234/100,000 in 2015/16 to 222.3/100,000 by 2019/20.. The objectives of this program are: To increase equitable access to ART by those in need from 64% (2016) to 81% by 2020. To increase condom use at high risk sex from 50% to 75% by 2020. To increase case notification rate of incident TB cases from 119/100,000 in 2015/16 to 156/100,00 in 2019/20; and to increase treatment success rate among notified incident cases from 74% in 2015/26 to 85% by 2019/20;. To strengthen TB-HIV integrated care for co-infected patients and increase ART coverage among TB/HIV co-infected patients from 88% in 2015/16 to 95% by 2019/20. To increase CDR DR-TB from 17% in 2015/16 to 51% in 2019/20; and raise TSR from 74% in 2015/16 to 80% by 2019/20. To strengthen systems for effective management of Tuberculosis & Leprosy services to meet the NSP targets

title.narrative: Outcome indicator for UGA-C-TASO
Percentage of people living with HIV and on ART who are virologically suppressed
Case notification rate of all forms of TB per 100,000 population - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases
Percentage of people living with HIV who know their HIV status at the end of the reporting period
Percent of respondents who say they used a condom the last time they had sex with a non-marital, non-cohabiting partner, of those who have had sex with such a partner in the last 12 months
Percentage of women and men aged 15-49 who had more than one partner in the past 12 months who used a condom during their last sexual intercourse
Percentage of (estimated) people living with HIV who have been tested HIV-positive
Treatment success rate of all forms of TB - bacteriologically confirmed plus clinically diagnosed, new and relapse cases
Treatment success rate of RR TB and/or MDR-TB: Percentage of cases with RR and/or MDR-TB successfully treated
Percentage of adults and children with HIV, known to be on treatment 12 months after initiation of antiretroviral therapy
Coverage / Output indicator for UGA-C-TASO
Percentage of sex workers reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of sex workers that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Number of adolescent girls and young women who were tested for HIV and received their results during the reporting period
Percentage of men who have sex with men that have received an HIV test during the reporting period and know their results
Percentage of men who have sex with men reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Percentage of adolescent girls and young women reached with HIV prevention programs- defined package of services
Percentage of MSM reached with HIV prevention programs - defined package of services
Number of people in contact with TB patients who began preventive therapy
Impact indicator for UGA-C-TASO
Number of new HIV infections per 1000 uninfected population
Number of AIDS-related deaths per 100,000 population
AIDS related mortality per 100,000 population
TB incidence rate per 100,000 population
Percentage of young people aged 15-24 who are living with HIV
